info.title: idocs api document
info.description:
Use this API to get the user authorization. After this API is called successfully, you can get the authorization URL and redirect users to the authorization URL to agree to authorize. After the user agrees to authorize, the wallet redirects the user back to a redirection URL that is reconstructed with values of authRedirectUrl, authCode, and authState. For example, the redirection URL might be https://www.merchant.com/authorizationResult?authCode=3AB2F588D14B43238637264FCA5AAF35&authState=663A8FA9-D836-48EE-8AA1-1FF682989DC7.

Structure

A message consists of a header and body. The following sections are focused on the body structure. For the header structure, see£º 

  • Request header
  • Response header


Note: Set the data type of each field (except array) as String. This means that you must use double quotation marks (" ") to enclose the field value. Examples:

  • If the data type of a field is Integer and its value is 20, set it as "20". 
  • If the data type of a field is Boolean and its value is true, set it as "true".
info.descriptionLake:
Use this API to get the user authorization. After this API is called successfully, you can get the authorization URL and redirect users to the authorization URL to agree to authorize. After the user agrees to authorize, the wallet redirects the user back to a redirection URL that is reconstructed with values of authRedirectUrl, authCode, and authState. For example, the redirection URL might be https://www.merchant.com/authorizationResult?authCode=3AB2F588D14B43238637264FCA5AAF35&authState=663A8FA9-D836-48EE-8AA1-1FF682989DC7.

Structure

A message consists of a header and body. The following sections are focused on the body structure. For the header structure, see£º 

  • Request header
  • Response header


Note: Set the data type of each field (except array) as String. This means that you must use double quotation marks (" ") to enclose the field value. Examples:

  • If the data type of a field is Integer and its value is 20, set it as "20". 
  • If the data type of a field is Boolean and its value is true, set it as "true".

customerBelongsTo.description: The wallet that the user uses. See Payment methods to check the valid values.
customerBelongsTo.descriptionLake: The wallet that the user uses. See Payment methods to check the valid values.

authClientId.description:
The unique ID of the secondary merchant to which the user grants resource access permission. The value is specified by the acquirer and needs to be registered in Alipay.  

Notes: 

  • Specify this field if you are an acquirer with secondary merchants.
  • For an #REUSE#A+MPP#ID3d797c86-dc77-46f8-b31e-7055f1241358#, the value of this field is the same as the value of the referenceMerchantId field in the pay (Auto Debit) interface.
authClientId.descriptionLake:
The unique ID of the secondary merchant to which the user grants resource access permission. The value is specified by the acquirer and needs to be registered in Alipay.  

Notes: 

  • Specify this field if you are an acquirer with secondary merchants.
  • For an #REUSE#A+MPP#ID3d797c86-dc77-46f8-b31e-7055f1241358#, the value of this field is the same as the value of the referenceMerchantId field in the pay (Auto Debit) interface.

authRedirectUrl.description: The redirection URL that the user is redirected to after the user agrees to authorize. This value is provided by the merchant.
authRedirectUrl.descriptionLake: The redirection URL that the user is redirected to after the user agrees to authorize. This value is provided by the merchant.

scopes.description:
The authorization scope. Valid values are:  

  • BASE_USER_INFO: Indicates that the unique user ID can be obtained.
  • USER_INFO: Indicates that the complete user information can be obtained, for example, user name, avatar, and other user information.
  • AGREEMENT_PAY: Indicates that the user agrees to authorize for auto debit so that the merchant can use the access token to automatically deduct money from the user's account.
scopes.descriptionLake:
The authorization scope. Valid values are:  

  • BASE_USER_INFO: Indicates that the unique user ID can be obtained.
  • USER_INFO: Indicates that the complete user information can be obtained, for example, user name, avatar, and other user information.
  • AGREEMENT_PAY: Indicates that the user agrees to authorize for auto debit so that the merchant can use the access token to automatically deduct money from the user's account.

authState.description: The unique ID generated by the merchant to represent the consult request. The consistency of this field and that in the redirection URL when the user agrees to authorize needs to be guaranteed.
authState.descriptionLake: The unique ID generated by the merchant to represent the consult request. The consistency of this field and that in the redirection URL when the user agrees to authorize needs to be guaranteed.

terminalType.description:
Terminal type of which the merchant service applies to. Valid values are:

  • WEB: The client-side terminal type is a website that is opened via a web browser.
  • WAP: The client-side terminal type is an HTML page that is opened via a mobile browser.
  • APP: The client-side terminal type is a mobile application.
  • MINI_APP: The terminal type of the merchant side is a mini program on the mobile phone.
terminalType.descriptionLake:
Terminal type of which the merchant service applies to. Valid values are:

  • WEB: The client-side terminal type is a website that is opened via a web browser.
  • WAP: The client-side terminal type is an HTML page that is opened via a mobile browser.
  • APP: The client-side terminal type is a mobile application.
  • MINI_APP: The terminal type of the merchant side is a mini program on the mobile phone.

osType.description:
The OS type. Valid values are: 

  • IOS: indicates the operation system is Apple's iOS.
  • ANDROID indicates the operation system is Google's Android.

Note: This field is required when terminalType is APP , WAP or MINI_APP.
osType.descriptionLake:
The OS type. Valid values are: 

  • IOS: indicates the operation system is Apple's iOS.
  • ANDROID indicates the operation system is Google's Android.

Note: This field is required when terminalType is APP , WAP or MINI_APP.

osVersion.description:
The OS version. 

Specify this parameter when the value of terminalType is APP or WAP and you have this information. Providing this information makes the user's payment experience better.
osVersion.descriptionLake:
The OS version. 

Specify this parameter when the value of terminalType is APP or WAP and you have this information. Providing this information makes the user's payment experience better.

merchantRegion.description:
The country or region where the merchant or secondary merchant operates the business. The parameter is a 2-letter country/region code that follows ISO 3166 Country Codes standard. Only US, JP, PK, SG are supported now.

Note: This field is required when you use the Global Acquirer Gateway (GAGW) product.
merchantRegion.descriptionLake:
The country or region where the merchant or secondary merchant operates the business. The parameter is a 2-letter country/region code that follows ISO 3166 Country Codes standard. Only US, JP, PK, SG are supported now.

Note: This field is required when you use the Global Acquirer Gateway (GAGW) product.

resultCode.description: Result code. Possible values are listed in the Result/Error codes table on this page.
resultCode.descriptionLake: Result code. Possible values are listed in the Result/Error codes table on this page.

resultStatus.description:
Result status. Valid values are:  

  • S: Indicates that this API is called successfully and the authorization URL is obtained.
  • F: Indicates that this API calling is failed. The authorization URL is not obtained.
  • U: Indicates that the calling status of this API is unknown. Retry the calling process.
resultStatus.descriptionLake:
Result status. Valid values are:  

  • S: Indicates that this API is called successfully and the authorization URL is obtained.
  • F: Indicates that this API calling is failed. The authorization URL is not obtained.
  • U: Indicates that the calling status of this API is unknown. Retry the calling process.

resultMessage.description: Result message that explains the result code.
resultMessage.descriptionLake: Result message that explains the result code.

result.description: Indicates whether this API is called successfully. If this API is successfully called, the authorization URL can be obtained.
result.descriptionLake: Indicates whether this API is called successfully. If this API is successfully called, the authorization URL can be obtained.

schemeUrl.description:
The URL scheme that redirects users to open an app in an Android or iOS system when the target app is installed.

Note: When the value of result.resultCode is S, at least one of schemeUrl, applinkUrl, and normalUrl is to be returned.
schemeUrl.descriptionLake:
The URL scheme that redirects users to open an app in an Android or iOS system when the target app is installed.

Note: When the value of result.resultCode is S, at least one of schemeUrl, applinkUrl, and normalUrl is to be returned.

applinkUrl.description:
The URL that redirects users to open an app when the target app is installed, or to open a WAP page when the target app is not installed. For Android, the URL is a Native App Link. For iOS, the URL is a Universal Link.

Note: When the value of result.resultCode is S, at least one of schemeUrl, applinkUrl, and normalUrl is to be returned.
applinkUrl.descriptionLake:
The URL that redirects users to open an app when the target app is installed, or to open a WAP page when the target app is not installed. For Android, the URL is a Native App Link. For iOS, the URL is a Universal Link.

Note: When the value of result.resultCode is S, at least one of schemeUrl, applinkUrl, and normalUrl is to be returned.

appIdentifier.description:
Android package name, which is used for Android app to open a cashier page.

Note: This field is returned when result.resultCode is S and terminalType is APP or WAP.
appIdentifier.descriptionLake:
Android package name, which is used for Android app to open a cashier page.

Note: This field is returned when result.resultCode is S and terminalType is APP or WAP.

normalUrl.description:
The URL that redirects users to a WAP or WEB page in the default browser or the embedded WebView.

Note: When the value of result.resultCode is S, at least one of schemeUrl, applinkUrl, and normalUrl is to be returned.
normalUrl.descriptionLake:
The URL that redirects users to a WAP or WEB page in the default browser or the embedded WebView.

Note: When the value of result.resultCode is S, at least one of schemeUrl, applinkUrl, and normalUrl is to be returned.

displayType.description:
Indicates the code value type. Valid values are:

  • TEXT: indicates the code value type is the original text of the QR code. You need to use codeValue to convert the text into an image and display the image for buyers.
  • IMAGE: indicates the code value type is the image of the QR code. You can directly display the image for buyers.
displayType.descriptionLake:
Indicates the code value type. Valid values are:

  • TEXT: indicates the code value type is the original text of the QR code. You need to use codeValue to convert the text into an image and display the image for buyers.
  • IMAGE: indicates the code value type is the image of the QR code. You can directly display the image for buyers.

codeValue.description:
The value of the code.

  • If the value of displayType is IMAGE, this parameter indicates a plain or Base64-encoded image URL.
  • If the value of displayType is TEXT, this parameter indicates a text string. You need to convert the text into a QR code image to display for buyers.
codeValue.descriptionLake:
The value of the code.

  • If the value of displayType is IMAGE, this parameter indicates a plain or Base64-encoded image URL.
  • If the value of displayType is TEXT, this parameter indicates a text string. You need to convert the text into a QR code image to display for buyers.

codeDetails.description: A list of QR code information.
codeDetails.descriptionLake: A list of QR code information.

authCodeForm.description:
The information about the authorization QR code.

This parameter is returned when the payment method supports authorization through QR code scanning.
authCodeForm.descriptionLake:
The information about the authorization QR code.

This parameter is returned when the payment method supports authorization through QR code scanning.

x-result.message: Success
x-result.action: The interface is called successfully. Obtain schemeUrl, applinkUrl, or normalUrl from the response.
x-result.actionLake: The interface is called successfully. Obtain schemeUrl, applinkUrl, or normalUrl from the response.

x-result.message: Access is denied.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The client is not authorized to use this API.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The access token is expired, revoked, or does not exist.
x-result.action: Check whether accessToken is correct. If not correct, pass in the correct value. If correct, contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Check whether accessToken is correct. If not correct, pass in the correct value. If correct, contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The called API is invalid or not active.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support to resolve the issue.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support to resolve the issue.

x-result.message: The client status is invalid.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The signature is not validated. The private key used to sign a request does not match the public key of Antom Dashboard.
x-result.action:
Check whether the private key used to sign a request matches the public key of Antom Dashboard. The following signature references are useful:

  • The signature field in a request header 
  • How to calculate a signature
x-result.actionLake:
Check whether the private key used to sign a request matches the public key of Antom Dashboard. The following signature references are useful:

  • The signature field in a request header 
  • How to calculate a signature

x-result.message: The private key or public key of Alipay or the merchant is not found.
x-result.action: Check whether the private key or public key exists. If not, upload the private key in Antom Dashboard.
x-result.actionLake: Check whether the private key or public key exists. If not, upload the private key in Antom Dashboard.

x-result.message: The merchant is not registered.
x-result.action: Please register the merchant by using the registration interface. Contact Alipay Technical Support if failed to call the registration interface.
x-result.actionLake: Please register the merchant by using the registration interface. Contact Alipay Technical Support if failed to call the registration interface.

x-result.message: API is not defined.
x-result.action: Check whether the URL is correct. Please refer to the endpoint in the API documentation.
x-result.actionLake: Check whether the URL is correct. Please refer to the endpoint in the API documentation.

x-result.message: The payment method is not supported by this API.
x-result.action: Check whether the payment method is a valid value for the customerBelongsTo parameter. If the value you passed in is correct, contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Check whether the payment method is a valid value for the customerBelongsTo parameter. If the value you passed in is correct, contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: OAuth process failed.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The required parameters are not passed, or illegal parameters exist. For example, a non-numeric input, an invalid date, or the length and type of the parameter are wrong.
x-result.action: Check and verify whether the required request fields (including the header fields and body fields) of the current API are correctly passed and valid.
x-result.actionLake: Check and verify whether the required request fields (including the header fields and body fields) of the current API are correctly passed and valid.

x-result.message: The merchant is not qualified to pay because the merchant is not registered, does not have a contract for Auto Debit payment, or is forbidden to make a payment.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: A general business failure occurred.
x-result.action: Do not retry. Human intervention is usually needed. It is recommended that you contact Alipay Technical Support to troubleshoot the issue.
x-result.actionLake: Do not retry. Human intervention is usually needed. It is recommended that you contact Alipay Technical Support to troubleshoot the issue.

x-result.message: The request is rejected because of the risk control.
x-result.action: Prompt the user that the request is rejected because the risk control failed.
x-result.actionLake: Prompt the user that the request is rejected because the risk control failed.

x-result.message: A system error occurred.
x-result.action: Do not retry, and contact Alipay Technical Support for more details.
x-result.actionLake: Do not retry, and contact Alipay Technical Support for more details.

x-result.message: The client is unknown.
x-result.action: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.
x-result.actionLake: Contact Alipay Technical Support for detailed reasons.

x-result.message: The request traffic exceeds the limit.
x-result.action: Call the interface again to resolve the issue. If not resolved, contact Alipay Technical Support.
x-result.actionLake: Call the interface again to resolve the issue. If not resolved, contact Alipay Technical Support.

x-result.message: An API call has failed, which is caused by unknown reasons.
x-result.action: Call the interface again to resolve the issue. If not resolved, contact Alipay Technical Support.
x-result.actionLake: Call the interface again to resolve the issue. If not resolved, contact Alipay Technical Support.

post.x-more:
Result process logic

For different request results, different actions are to be performed. See the following list for details:

  • If the value of result.resultStatus is S, the authorization URL is successfully obtained by the schemeUrl, applinkUrl, or normalUrl field in the response. The merchant can redirect the user to this URL to agree to authorize for granting corresponding resource access permission.
  • If the value of result.resultStatus is U, the API calling status is unknown. You can call this API again to retry the process.
  • If the value of result.resultStatus is F, the authorization URL is failed to be obtained. Generally, this case is caused by system defects or system failure. Check the error codes and take the corresponding actions or contact Alipay technical support.

Result process logic

For different request results, different actions are to be performed. See the following list for details:

  • If the value of result.resultStatus is S, the authorization URL is successfully obtained by the schemeUrl, applinkUrl, or normalUrl field in the response. The merchant can redirect the user to this URL to agree to authorize for granting corresponding resource access permission.
  • If the value of result.resultStatus is U, the API calling status is unknown. You can call this API again to retry the process.
  • If the value of result.resultStatus is F, the authorization URL is failed to be obtained. Generally, this case is caused by system defects or system failure. Check the error codes and take the corresponding actions or contact Alipay technical support.
